title: Probability of another 25bps rate cut by October rises: Puneet Pal
summary: Indian bond yields remained high, with the 10-year segment underperforming. CPI inflation fell to 2.10%, driven by lower food prices, raising hopes for RBI rate cuts. WPI inflation also slowed. Exports to the US increased, but overall exports were flat.
fullContent: Indian bond yields remained high, with the 10-year segment underperforming. CPI inflation fell to 2.10%, driven by lower food prices, raising hopes for RBI rate cuts. WPI inflation also slowed. Exports to the US increased, but overall exports were flat. A potential US tariff on Indian imports could impact GDP. The fiscal deficit stood at 18% in Q1FY26.

Paint makers anticipate stronger performance in August and September, driven by an earlier Diwali, expecting a boost in sales.

title: China Oil Demand Picks Up in July
summary: The amount of crude oil going into storage in China has declined from 1.42 million barrels daily in June to 530,000 barrels daily in July, suggesting a pick-up in demand, as reported by Reuters’ Clyde Russell. Refinery rates went up to 14.
fullContent: The amount of crude oil going into storage in China has declined from 1.42 million barrels daily in June to 530,000 barrels daily in July, suggesting a pick-up in demand, as reported by Reuters’ Clyde Russell. Refinery rates went up to 14.85 million barrels daily last month, the report also said, which was an 8.9% increase from July 2024, but at the same time, it was a 2% decline from June 2025. The utilization rate at Chinese refineries, however, rose both on an annual and on a monthly basis, reinforcing the perception of an improvement…

India's Kotak Mahindra unit secures UAE licence to sell funds to retail investors
summary: Kotak International has secured a license from the UAE to offer investment funds to onshore retail investors, becoming the first Indian firm to achieve this milestone. This move allows Kotak to directly target retail clients with India-focused funds, with a minimum investment...
fullContent: Kotak International has secured a license from the UAE to offer investment funds to onshore retail investors, becoming the first Indian firm to achieve this milestone. This move allows Kotak to directly target retail clients with India-focused funds, with a minimum investment of $500, capitalizing on the growing interest in Indian markets and the strong Indian diaspora in the UAE.

title: India’s Russian Oil Purchases Are ‘Opportunistic,’ Navarro Says
summary: The dramatic increase in India’s buying of Russian oil since the invasion of Ukraine is “opportunistic and deeply corrosive” of a global effort to isolate the Kremlin and curb Vladimir Putin’s war machine, White House trade adviser Peter Navarro wrote in the Financial Times.
fullContent: The dramatic increase in India’s buying of Russian oil since the invasion of Ukraine is “opportunistic and deeply corrosive” of a global effort to isolate the Kremlin and curb Vladimir Putin’s war machine, White House trade adviser Peter Navarro wrote in the Financial Times.

title: Easy Trip Planners shares slide 4% as Q1 PAT drops 99% YoY to Rs 0.44 cr
summary: Easy Trip Planners shares: Revenue from operations came in at ₹113.79 crore in Q1FY26, down from ₹152.6 crore in the same quarter last year. Adjusted total income, including other income, slipped to ₹166.24 crore from ₹208.16 crore a year earlier.
fullContent: Easy Trip Planners shares: Revenue from operations came in at ₹113.79 crore in Q1FY26, down from ₹152.6 crore in the same quarter last year. Adjusted total income, including other income, slipped to ₹166.24 crore from ₹208.16 crore a year earlier.

title: Debt market to deepen as overseas participation rises after rating upgrade: Vijay Kuppaa
summary: India's sovereign rating upgrade is poised to boost foreign investor confidence in its debt market, potentially leading to global debt index inclusion and attracting long-term institutional investors.
fullContent: India's sovereign rating upgrade is poised to boost foreign investor confidence in its debt market, potentially leading to global debt index inclusion and attracting long-term institutional investors. Increased overseas participation in government securities and high-grade corporate bonds is expected to improve liquidity and deepen the market. This creates an opportune phase for domestic investors to lock in attractive rates.
